Package io.pyroscope.labels.v2

Class ScopedContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.pyroscope.labels.v2.ScopedContext
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable
    public final class ScopedContext
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.AutoCloseable
    ScopedContext associates profiling data with a set of labels for the current execution scope. Unlike ConstantContext, a ScopedContext is designed for dynamic, temporary use and will be properly garbage collected.

    ScopedContext implements AutoCloseable, allowing it to be used in try-with-resources blocks for automatic cleanup when the context goes out of scope.

    When a ScopedContext is closed, it's marked as such but remains in memory until the next call to Pyroscope.LabelsWrapper.dump(). After being included in a dump, closed contexts are removed from the internal map, allowing them to be garbage collected.

    All constructor parameters (labels, previous context) must be non-null. Attempting to create a ScopedContext with null parameters will result in a NullPointerException.

    Use ScopedContext for:

    • High-cardinality labels (like request IDs, user IDs, etc.)
    • Temporary, request-scoped labels that change frequently
    • User-controlled or dynamically generated values
    • Any labels that would result in memory leaks if kept indefinitely

    Example usage: 

    
 // For a single block of code with labels
 try (ScopedContext ctx = new ScopedContext(new LabelsSet("request_id", requestId))) {
     // Do work that will be profiled with this context
     processRequest();
 } // Context automatically closed here

 // Or using the helper method in Pyroscope.LabelsWrapper:
 Pyroscope.LabelsWrapper.run(new LabelsSet("span_id", spanId), () -> {
     // Operations to perform with this context
     executeSpan();
 });

    • Constructor Detail

      • ScopedContext

        public ScopedContext​(@NotNull
                     @NotNull LabelsSet labels)
        Creates a new ScopedContext with the given labels. The previous context ID is set to 0 (root context).
        Parameters:
        labels - The labels to associate with this context
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if labels is null

      • ScopedContext

        public ScopedContext​(@NotNull
                     @NotNull LabelsSet labels,
                     @NotNull
                     @NotNull ScopedContext prev)
        Creates a new ScopedContext with the given labels, using the previous context's ID. This allows for proper nesting of contexts.
        Parameters:
        labels - The labels to associate with this context
        prev - The previous context that this context will replace temporarily
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if labels or prev is null

    • Method Detail

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes this context, restoring the previous context.

        The context is marked as closed, but will remain in memory until the next call to Pyroscope.LabelsWrapper.dump() which will clean up closed contexts.

        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable

      • forEachLabel

        public void forEachLabel​(@NotNull
                         @NotNull java.util.function.BiConsumer<@NotNull java.lang.String,​@NotNull java.lang.String> labelConsumer)
        Applies a consumer function to each label in this context.
        Parameters:
        labelConsumer - A function that will be called with each key-value pair in the labels
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if labelConsumer is null
